body: I've set up the Dashboard, what do I need to provide for review?
You could open the PR to provide MAL, Dashboard, and document, as well as screenshots or recorded videos.
Which doc should I change? `docs/en/setup/backend/backend-receivers.md`   and   `CHANGES.md` ?

There are several changes you should do 1. Move [Virtual Database](https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/setup/service-agent/virtual-database/) under general service as a sub menu 2. Add a new [MySQL Database] doc at the place of current Virtual Database. 3. The content of the doc could refer https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/setup/backend/backend-k8s-monitoring/, which should include intro, dataflow, setup, metrics list, and all relative things which would be helpful for end users. And the document should be pinned and linked at the top of your root dashboard like this,
And which folder should I add file to?
I get it.

And then, 

1. https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/setup/backend/opentelemetry-receiver/ As you are using OC receiver to access the data, the new rule name should be added here.

But what is this? `docs/en/setup/backend/backend-receivers.md`.  Is this an expired doc?

I see it(docs/en/setup/backend/backend-receivers.md) in the commit of `support k8s monitoring` , maybe is expired.
Anyway, I understand. I'll finish it tomorrow.
I have sent the PR, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/9432
It causes a conflict. I don't know why.
It mean layer file was changed by others. This is a common case in git. Search for git conflict on google, it will guide you to resolve it.
OK, I have resolved it.
Some checks were not successful. And I don't know why too.

>  If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #.

Don't forget to put issue No. after the `#`.

> Update the [CHANGES log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/changes/changes.md).

You forgot to update the change log.

@Fine0830 Please help with moving the virtual database as a sub-menu of general service(So, general service could have two children, services, and a virtual database). And change the virtual database to Database, then add MySQL as a sub and a root layer(layer==MYSQL)

You could follow the GHA control file to run e2e locally. The e2e is using [e2e tool](https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/skywalking-infra-e2e/latest/readme/) to define the env and verify result. You would be asked to add an e2e for this case too. https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/4bd4231b6067ddfe70079754c84d9b121982b2bf/.github/workflows/skywalking.yaml#L300-L301 If you can see this `details` button, you could check the e2e logs here. But it is better you would run on your own.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

> > If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #.
> 
> Don't forget to put issue No. after the `#`.
> 
> > Update the [CHANGES log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/changes/changes.md).
> 
> You forgot to update the change log.

I thought there would be other PR, so I didn't set them. I will change it later.
Another PR is about?

> Another PR is about?

About the showcase. I think I should close the issue after complete the showcase at that time.

> > Another PR is about?
> 
> About the showcase. I think I should close the issue after complete the showcase at that time.

I see. Showcase is a thing nice to have, it doesn't need to be tracked from here. Because we never could make all features available on showcase.

If you want to keep it open, it is fine. But you should link this PR to the issue in the description(not behind the `close` keyword). Because in the commit logs, you could have the PR before the issue.

> > > Another PR is about?
> > 
> > 
> > About the showcase. I think I should close the issue after complete the showcase at that time.

> 
> If you want to keep it open, it is fine. But you should link this PR to the issue in the description(not behind the `close` keyword). Because in the commit logs, you could have the PR before the issue.

I understand. I will fix them all tomorow.
About the dashboard JSON file, If I add the Apache license , It will failed in import(It will suceess without the license). Is that normal?
What do you mean? They all have license header. https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/oap-server/server-starter/src/main/resources/ui-initialized-templates/browser/browser-app.json

> What do you mean? They all have license header. https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/oap-server/server-starter/src/main/resources/ui-initialized-templates/browser/browser-app.json

Yes.,others have the same problem. When I use the UI, I delete a dashboard and import the JSON to UI, if the JSON file has a license, the website will not respond anything.If not , it will show a message that save successfully.
That file is not for importing, it is automatically initialized by OAP in booting.
UI has updated. Please sync with master, and notice UI submodule update, choose commit ID correctly.
OK

Hi, @yswdqz I labeled this PR as `high priority`, which means, this would block the 9.2.0 release. 
The only reason I did this is, we have changed the menu at the UI side. We should make sure this is ready before publishing the release.

Don't worry, you should have enough time. More than 2 weeks to release.

> Hi, @yswdqz I labeled this PR as `high priority`, which means, this would block the 9.2.0 release. The only reason I did this is, we have changed the menu at the UI side. We should make sure this is ready before publishing the release.
> 
> Don't worry, you should have enough time. More than 2 weeks to release.

I understand. I will do my best to complete it !
I have a problem that I can't see my dashboard without import. I have put the dashboard file to ui-initialized-templates, need I do some other things to help the oap automatically initialized ?
You need to clear your storage, then you should update `UITemplateInitializer` to add the new layer to activate the folder to initialize.
OK, I get it.

A tip, don't push many small commits continuously in a short time. Because you may trigger many CI processes in a short time. Also, in an open-source experience, many projects would ask you to rebase all commits to only keep one. SkyWalking is fine, we could squash all commits in the final merge. (One commit in the master branch for one PR only).

> A tip, don't push many small commits continuously in a short time. Because you may trigger many CI processes in a short time. Also, in an open-source experience, many projects would ask you to rebase all commits to only keep one. SkyWalking is fine, we could squash all commits in the final merge. (One commit in the master branch for one PR only).

Thank you , It is my fault. I'm not very familiar with Git operations.I will do better in the future.

Is this OK?

![V2_HUXRC7PWKCL~)9YPFX{6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74546965/183297474-1b87cc81-7f1c-4cac-a18f-28569da4f184.png)
The layout is good, please make sure the units are added.

I think the mysql_uptime's unit should be day, the innodb_pool_size's unit should be MB. Others should be unitless(TPS QPS Trend , and I think the unit of thread/connects should not set), so I have not set for them.

> I think the mysql_uptime's unit should be day, the innodb_pool_size's unit should be MB. Others should be unitless(TPS QPS Trend , and I think the unit of thread/connects should not set), so I have not set for them.

I am just not sure about `the mysql_uptime's unit should be day`. Is this a setup from somewhere?

> > I think the mysql_uptime's unit should be day, the innodb_pool_size's unit should be MB. Others should be unitless(TPS QPS Trend , and I think the unit of thread/connects should not set), so I have not set for them.
> 
> I am just not sure about `the mysql_uptime's unit should be day`. Is this a setup from somewhere?

A dashboard of Grafana set the unit to week, such as 1.9 week . I think day maybe more precise.

.
Thanks for sharing. Let's keep on days.

I'm confused, too. I always fail to upload videos. I've changed it to pictures.

Anyway, you could recheck after your new e2e is submitted.

OK, I am editing the new e2e. I will finish it later.

The file is following: https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/4bd4231b6067ddfe70079754c84d9b121982b2bf/test/e2e-v2/script/docker-compose/base-compose.yml#L20

I get it.
I have confirmed from demo env. The flush execution perf has been fixed.

actual:

My test-scenario is a web server , it accept healthy check request and test request .
When I run my test-scenario , I got above error .It seems like Plugin automatic test framework compare healthy check request with test request
Is there some way to ignore healthy-check-url when comparing segment info ? Or some else reason cause this problem ?

@wu-sheng
This is the issue. URI GET:/micronaut/success is checked, but fails, because tag doesn't match.

I misunderstood the report message . Haha

> This is the issue. URI GET:/micronaut/success is checked, but fails, because tag doesn't match.
Any issue blocking you?
I can't rerun the fail task, GHA seems not responding.
Yes, I found that the docker image `skywalking/oap` does not have the code I committed here. What do I do to add these codes？
Yes, it would not exist as it is unmerged. You should use latest, take a reference from other e2e case.
Assuming moving forward I'm allowed to merge once tests pass and reviewers have approved changes. Let me know if not.

It is OK to merge, but you should remove all commit details, as they are not very useful.
We are using squash merge.
You could check the latest commit log, it includes two useless sentences.
Ah, I see. Will do going forward.
So I just need to use latest oap , and when I commit to github, it will run with the image contain my code?

The infra e2e should build your image first before testing AFAIK.

@kezhenxu94 Could you help on clarifing this process?

> So I just need to use latest oap , and when I commit to github, it will run with the image contain my code?

This is how it works in GitHub Actions:

- Build a Docker image `skywalking/oap:latest` from the codes in this PR.
- Test using the image `skywalking/oap:latest`.

If you want to test locally, you need to build the `skywalking/oap:latest` locally first, for example, `make build.all docker.all`, to skip test `SKIP_TEST=true make build.all docker.all`, then you can run the tests

I think this is the CI step to build image and make it available in the e2e testing.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/5ba874a49946571506b6cb3c1abbf0d4ce1863bf/.github/workflows/skywalking.yaml#L161-L172
Thank you, I will take a try.

I am comfused about this line :
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/test/e2e-v2/cases/vm/expected/service.yml#L17
What does b64enc mean？

BTW, the rest went well, I also found the cause of the CI error, I will fix it together.
The ID is BASE64 encoded, we prefer the raw data in the expected file. `b64enc` is a base64 encoding function in this go template.
I am comfused about that some metrics（such as the rate of delete command always have a value 0 , so they can't pass the test of ge.value 1(to confirm their exist). How can I resolve it?

> I am comfused about that some metrics（such as the rate of delete command always have a value 0 , so they can't pass the test of ge.value 1(to confirm their exist). How can I resolve it?

If you don't mock this metric in the e2e, you should not test this metric :) If you want to test this, run some `delete` statements in your e2e.

The one is invoke self by localhost, other one is call a common domain

8/10/2022 2:44:58 PM 2022-08-10 18:44:58.862  INFO 1 --- [           main] o.a.s.o.s.webapp.ApplicationStartUp      : Started ApplicationStartUp in 7.44 seconds (JVM running for 8.518)

> We have Java test services here, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/test/e2e-v2/java-test-service
> 
> They are built as docker images in e2e. You could add another service for MySQL case written in python or node or something
> 
> @kezhenxu94 Where do we build the e2e service in CI?

We build those test services here https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/.github/workflows/publish-docker-e2e-service.yaml .

To execute some MySQL commands, I think you can just start a MySQL container (in the same network of MySQL server within the same docker-compose) and send some commands stored in a `.sql` file? like `mysql yourdatabase < test.sql`

```yaml
  mysql:
    image: mysql/mysql-server:8.0.13
    networks:
      - e2e
    entrypoint: bash
    command:
      - -c
      - "mysql -h the-mysql-server-container-name -u yourusername -p yourpassword yourdatabase < test.sql"
```
I get it, I will change them together.

Please report to the Pulsar community if you have used the latest Java agent(8.11). I can see 2.8.1 has been tested when they contributed this plugin, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/blob/main/test/plugin/scenarios/pulsar-scenario/support-version.list

We are just hosting the source codes, and they are maintaining how this works.

I have a problem about docker-compose. I start a service to execute sql, and I hope this service start after otel-collector's first fetch from mysqld-exporter. Only in this case the test will pass. I use `depends_on` to do that, but it can't work well(`depends_on` can only guarantee the container startup order ).
You could just simply execute SQLs periodly. That depends is only about service standby.

> I have a problem about docker-compose. I start a service to execute sql, and I hope this service start after otel-collector's first fetch from mysqld-exporter. Only in this case the test will pass. I use `depends_on` to do that, but it can't work well(`depends_on` can only guarantee the container startup order ).

Hi, `depends_on` can work with healthiness check, you can add healthiness check for `otel-collector` to guarantee `otel-collector` starts successfully, after that, the sql executor then starts, so the metrics won't be missed by the collector. Refer to example like this https://github.com/mrproliu/skywalking/blob/9e15a170e8ec0f6dc1282d221ac39f233c028e17/test/e2e-v2/cases/ttl/postgresql/docker-compose.yml#L43-L45 and https://github.com/mrproliu/skywalking/blob/9e15a170e8ec0f6dc1282d221ac39f233c028e17/test/e2e-v2/cases/ttl/postgresql/docker-compose.yml#L28-L32

Executing the test sql periodically is also an option.

Add logging:
https://github.com/apache/skywalking-rust/pull/41

Thank you for your help! But I failed to set up healthiness check.
Finally, I fix it by executing the test SQL periodically. Now, it will pass every time when I run in local.
